column2: Job Title:  Head, Supply Chain Department:   Supply Chain Management Reporting to:  Managing Director Interested candidates please email your updated CV on "gaurav@flexymanagers.com" or what's app on +919599518777 Job Purpose Supply chain managers keep track of logistics and update the company's inventory. They analyze operational performance and resolve issues. They also collaborate with vendors and suppliers to ensure all operations (e.g. sales, shipping, and delivery) meet quality and safety standards. Role & responsibilities     Supply Chain Head to ensure our supply chain and logistics operations function properly.  He collaborates with other departments, such as Sales/ Marketing and Finance, to create effective business plans, so teamwork skills are important.  You should also have experience in project management, as well as great leadership and communication ability. Create the companys supply chain strategy Analyze data from sales and delivering processes to find bottlenecks and other issues  Evaluate and report on KPIs  Monitor logistics to make sure they run smoothly  Manage the Warehouse according to the standards of cGWP / Local Govt. rules & Regulations and meeting the expectations / standard of the principal companies Maintain supply chain inventory and records Train and guide employees Find cost-effective solutions for supply chain processes Resolve issues that come up (e.g., delays in delivery, accidents) Collaborate with other departments to create coordinated plans for business growth Develop and implement safety guidelines in all aspects of the supply chain (e.g., use of trucks, forklifts) Ensure supply chain processes meet legal requirements and standards Communicate and negotiate with suppliers and vendors to land more profitable deals   KEY RESULT AREAS Inventory Control Inventory Accuracy Shrinkage Damage Control Inventory Turns &  Ageing Cost Control & Budgeting Delivery Cost Inventory Carrying Cost GIT (Goods-in-transit Insurance) Insurance of All Warehouses Pan Nigeria Resource Management Distribution Management Safety, Security & cGWP Regulatory & Liaison KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS Inventory Control 1.  Inventory Accuracy- 100% adherence Physical stocktaking process Once in a month for all SKUs- Report with variances, to be shared by 10th of every month. Perpetual counting for select SKUs: high-value SKUs list and plan of action to be shared. 2.  Shrinkage Damage Control- Nil Repackaging for Normal sales 3.  Inventory Turns & Ageing- Ageing Report- Once in a month D&D Report- Once in a month Non-moving stock for more than 90 days to be highlighted with the concerned NSM (copied to the Management) for further action. Report to be generated once a month Cost Control & Budgeting Delivery Cost- 2% Inventory Carrying Cost GIT (Goods-in-transit Insurance): 0.2% cost On-time reporting Insurance of All Warehouses Pan Nigeria- 15 Days in (upcountry) Warehouse & 7 days in transit Resource Management- Team Management- Training, SOPs, Coaching & Mentoring (Attrition Rate not to exceed 8%) Infrastructure Development: Semi-automatic Operation by December 2021 Space and Resources Utilization- 100% Distribution Management- OTIF 85% in TT &  90% in MT Fill rate for MT- 95% Distribution Lead-time as per agreed norms with stakeholders Safety, Security & cGWP- Safety: Zero accidents and no loss of lives Security: Defining and monitoring the security norms for the contractors Security: 100% up-time of CCTV Regulatory & Liaison- Proper documentation of SON, NAFDAC &  Customs Maintaining Required Documentation &  Records in the Warehouse Adherence to Local Government Regulations &  Certifications Relationship Management with Local Government Authorities, NAFDAC, Customs, SON, etc. WORKING INTERFACE Internal: Internal Departs- Sales / F& A / Marketing / Production External: Vendors, Govt. Authorities, Transport Partners Preferred candidate profile   Education Graduation in logistics, supply chain management or business administration Professional Qualification Associate Member of Certified Institute of Warehousing and Materials Management or any SCM Certification Exposure & Working knowledge with ERPs such as SAP / Oracle / MS Dynamics, Tally -9 etc. Good Working knowledge in MS Office (Excel / PowerPoint/ Word/ Outlook) Experience Minimum of 10 years cognate experience as a Supply Chain Manager working at a Food & Beverages, Home & Personal Care or Appliances & Electronics Warehouse Expertise in SCM procedures and best practices Experienced managing a team Proficient understanding of the fundamental concepts, practices and procedures of Supply Chain, Material Management, Warehouse Management, Logistics and all related focus areas Hands on experience with SCM software and databases Knowledge of ERP KEY COMPETENCIES REQUIREMENTS Technical Excellent proficiency in MS Office suite Strong organizational and time management skills Excellent understanding of modern warehousing / Logistics /SCM practices and methods Behavioral: Leadership skills and ability to manage staff- resolve conflicts, as well as keep employees motivated and on-task Strong decision making and problem-solving skills Excellent communication skills Strong critical thinking skills
column11: SCM, Distribution, FMCG, Warehouse Management, Inventory, Logistics

column2: Independently implement real estate plans with an understanding of the clients strategic real estate goals. Assists with project initiation and scope definition, prioritization of assignments, and adherence to client-driven priorities, commitments, and milestones.     Concurrently acts as landlord/seller agent and tenant/buyer agent and effectively negotiates the business terms and conditions for a wide variety of commercial real estate products, including land, office, retail and industrial. Supports and recommends initiatives on increased revenue/ management of business leads.     Coordinates field broker selection and other required resources, subject matter experts, and business partners. If necessary, facilitates client review and approval of proposed team resources for the purpose of transaction execution.     Draft and create a large variety of analyses and relevant documents, including but not limited to: project initiation, market comparable reports, Requests for Proposals (RFPs), proposal comparison packages, letters of intent, and brokers opinions of value. Provides inputs accordingly if required.     Coordinates the negotiation of sales, Negotiates leases and lease amendments. Monitors lease expirations. Negotiates lease renewals within prescribed timeline. Locates and acquires new properties to meet clients requirements and timeline. Disposes of surplus properties within prescribed timeline.     Review, analyze, and interpret financial analysis templates including book and cash flow projections, NPV (net present value), and/or IRR (internal rate of return) financial analyses to enable clients to make more informed decisions.     Works closely with the firm and/or clients Lease Administration, Project Management, Facility Management, and Finance/Accounting teams to ensure integration between the service lines.     Monitors and maintains a real estate project tracking system to ensure timely transaction completion. Prepares reports and makes presentations to relevant parties. Create MIS for local Business Development and tracks competition and supply along with Market intelligence.     Adheres to all state real estate agency requirements. Ensures compliance with corporate policies as they relate to identifying and mitigating potential conflicts of interest.     Responsible for quality and data in terms of overviews / RFPS/ templates/ case studies/ data management for the larger use of other regions as well for client presentations etc     Resolve landlord-tenant issues/disputes (if required)
column11: Data management, Financial analysis, MIS, Project management, Market intelligence, Agile, Cash flow, Facility management, commercial real estate, Logistics

column2: Our client is an AgriTech company that connects farmers to suppliers and buyers on a single platform. Online marketplace providing all the agricultural products and services to farmers.?They are seeking a dynamic and experienced professional to join our team as the Head of Supply Chain Management for our rapidly growing e-commerce company. As the primary leader in the supply chain function, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our end-to-end supply chain processes, ensuring efficiency, accuracy, and timely delivery of products to our customers. The ideal candidate will bring a strategic mindset, strong leadership skills, and a deep understanding of e-commerce supply chain dynamics.    1. Strategic Planning: Develop and execute a comprehensive supply chain strategy aligned with the company's overall business objectives. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate supply chain considerations into product development, sales, and marketing strategies. 2. Supplier Management: Oversee relationships with key suppliers, negotiating terms, and ensuring a reliable and cost-effective supply of goods. Implement vendor performance metrics and regularly assess supplier performance against established KPIs. 3. Inventory Management: Lead inventory planning and forecasting efforts to maintain optimal stock levels while minimizing excess inventory. Implement inventory control measures to prevent stockouts and overstock situations. 4. Logistics and Distribution: Design and optimize logistics and distribution networks to maximize efficiency and reduce lead times. Collaborate with third-party logistics partners to ensure seamless transportation and delivery processes. 5.Technology and Automation: Identify and implement technology solutions to enhance supply chain visibility, traceability, and overall efficiency. Evaluate and integrate automation opportunities within the supply chain, such as warehouse management systems (WMS) and order fulfillment technologies. 6.Risk Management: Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies for supply chain disruptions. Monitor global economic trends and regulatory changes impacting the supply chain. 7.Team Leadership and Development: Build and lead a high-performing supply chain team, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities for team members. Requirements Proven experience in supply chain management within the e-commerce B2C industry Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving skills. Excellent leadership and communication abilities. Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and technologies. In-depth knowledge, experience of logistics, 3PL logistics, warehouse, demand planning / forecasting, liquidation, sourcing & procurement.
column11: Operations Head, Strategic Planning, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Demand Forecasting, Logistics Planning, supplier management, Warehouse Operations, Capacity Planning, Inventory Management, Inventory Planning, Warehouse Management, inventory forecasting, Logistics

column2: Dear Candidates,        We are urgently hiring for Lead consultant / Sr. Planner role with one of the USA based IT MNC.            Job Description:        Responsibilities      To work with internal and external clients to deliver on specific metrics / goals as set by internal / external client management    Deliver on KPIs like fill rate, inventory targets, forecast accuracy for supply chain for clients.    Participate in client meetings for active collaboration and delivery of services. Be proactive in communicating with client.    Collaborate with internal solutions and other delivery excellence teams to create a world class delivery experience for our customers.    Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction score by exceeding on expectations proactively.    Proactively identify value initiatives and drive them to closure with measurable impact.    Lead various projects cutting across multiple delivery teams to create organization       Domain Skills    Understanding of various supply chain processes like forecasting , supply planning ,distribution planning ,inventory management      Should be able to analyse large sets of disconnected data applying statistical techniques like regression, correlation from a supply chain standpoint.    Strong exposure to After market Supply Chain Planning/Forecasting, Inventory Management and Analytics.    Brief exposure (Academic) to Operations Research optimization techniques like Linear Programming and Optimization.    Working knowledge of MS excel is a must ( Pivots , charts , trends , lookups )    Exposure to advanced tools like SAS , SPSS , MATLAB , R will be an added advantage    Working knowledge of MS Power point     Soft Skills    Fluent communication in English ( Written as well as Spoken)    Flexibility to quickly adapt to changing business needs like global working environments    Job may involve short term (4-8 weeks) travels to customer locations outside India. Hence preferable not to have any travel constraints.        Kindly revert with your updated Resume and following details on priya.tatke@humanforte.com.      Current CTC:  Expected CTC:  Notice Period:  Total years of experience:    Please note: Candidates with 30-45 days Notice Period will be preferred.

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for MS Dynamics SCM to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.We are looking for a skilled Microsoft Dynamics SCM Consultant to join our dynamic team. The Dynamics SCM Consultant will play a key role in implementing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics Supply Chain Management solutions for our clients. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in supply chain processes, experience with Dynamics SCM, and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.      Responsibilities : Requirements Gathering : Collaborate with clients to understand their supply chain management requirements and business processes.Conduct thorough analysis to identify gaps and propose Dynamics SCM solutions.Solution Design : Design end-to-end solutions using Microsoft Dynamics SCM to meet client requirements.Create functional specifications and documentation for customizations and configurations.Configuration and Customization : Customize and configure Microsoft Dynamics SCM to align with client-specific supply chain processes.Develop and maintain SCM workflows, business rules, and entities.Integration : Integrate Microsoft Dynamics SCM with other systems and applications, ensuring seamless data flow.Design and implement data migration strategies for supply chain data.      Reporting and Analytics : Develop custom reports and dashboards using Dynamics SCM reporting tools.Implement data visualization to provide insights into supply chain performance.Training and Support : Provide training to end-users on Dynamics SCM functionalities and best practices.Offer ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to ensure system reliability.Security and Compliance : Implement security models and access controls within Microsoft Dynamics SCM.Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations.Testing and Deployment : Conduct thorough testing of SCM customizations to ensure quality and reliability.Develop deployment plans and coordinate the release of SCM solutions.

column2: Job title: Site Supply Planner  Job Location: Bangalore  Primary Purpose  Regularly reviews generic capacity management for the plant, facilitates and drives plant S&OP and acts as the single point of contact in the plant for Global Supply Planning  Job Description  ??Own and Develop Plant Rough Cut Capacity Planning (RCCP -Generic and Specific)  ??Analyse all work centres and hierarchies for capacity overloads and under-loads (vs. Plant Planning Requirements, global demand plan), in order to establish which work centres/hierarchies will require further investigation as part of the Supply Planning Review.  ??Facilitate Plant Supply Review meeting  ??Ownership of Story Board development which consists of proposing initial categorisations (1,2,3,4) and reasons (man, machine, material) which are finalised during the Supply Planning Review and are reported to product management & included in the Executive Meeting.  ??Liaise with Global Demand Planners on demand clarifications  ??Loading of low risk component MPS into APO at plant level based on Plan for Every Part (PFEP)/Product Segmentation Analysis which drives ATO.  ??Ownership of inventory for ATO products  ??Serve as single-point-of-contact in the plant for the Global Supply Planner & Inventory Planner in resolving identified issues or making changes (e.g. CIC)  ??Work with Global Supply Planner, Scheduler & Operations on short- & medium-term actions to address CRD performance issues  ??Ownership of Site Planning Material Master Data Management (Lot size rule, Min Lot Size Qty, Published Lead-time)  ??Publish monthly plant attainment report  ??Works with Supply Chain Hubs for positioning FG for 100 % Service level and minimizing the freight cost.  ??Owns up complete Value Stream for the product / product family assigned and work on improving the Lead time.  Education  Required College or above  Preferred Major in Business Management or Supply Chain Management. APICS certification also required ( or achieved early after recruitment) Work Experience  Required More than 3 years planning experience. Experience in logistics and distribution would be added advantage. Preferred Multi-national company Electronics Industry Skills and Abilities:  ??Good communication skills, logical and analytical talent is essential .  ??Good written and spoken English ??Positive minded, self-starter who is a team player.  ??Ability to grasp new technologies  ??Can drive change within the plant Good PC skills especially MS Office, advanced Excel .  Practical knowledge of SAP MM/PP/SD modules as well as Business Warehouse .  Preferred  ??Knowledge of APO If interested please send your UPDATED Profile with below mentioned details. column2: Job Summary   The Head of Logistics will be responsible for overseeing the management and provision of professional services, including security, housekeeping, skilled labor, and professional drivers to in-house companies and external customers. This role involves strategic planning, coordination with internal and external clients, managing logistics personnel, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality services in a cost-effective and efficient manner. Role & responsibilities   1.  Strategic Planning and Execution: ? ?- Develop and implement logistics strategies that align with the company's overall objectives for providing professional services. ? ?- Create and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial plans for the logistics department. 2.  Operational Management: ? ?- Oversee the daily operations of logistics services, ensuring timely and efficient delivery of security, housekeeping, skilled labor, and professional driving services. ? ?- Optimize service delivery processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs. 3. Team Leadership: ? ?- Lead, mentor, and develop the logistics team to ensure high performance and professional growth. ? ?- Foster a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence. 4. Client and Stakeholder Management: ? ?- Build and maintain strong relationships with internal departments and external clients. ? ?- Understand client needs and ensure services are delivered to meet or exceed expectations. ? ?- Negotiate contracts and agreements to secure the best possible terms and conditions for the company. 5. Quality and Compliance: ? ?- Ensure all services comply with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. ? ?- Implement and maintain quality control systems to ensure high standards of service delivery. 6. Resource Management: ? ?- Oversee the recruitment, training, and management of logistics personnel, including security staff, housekeeping teams, skilled labor, and professional drivers. ? ?- Ensure optimal allocation and utilization of resources. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. A Master's degree or MBA is preferred. - Minimum of 10 to 18 years of experience in logistics management, with a proven track record of success in a senior leadership role. - Strong knowledge of logistics operations, service delivery, and industry best practices. - Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. - ?Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. - Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Key Competencies: - Strategic thinking and planning - Leadership and team management - Client relationship management - Negotiation and contract management - Financial acumen and budget management - Operational efficiency and process improvement - Customer-focused approach - Adaptability and flexibility
column11: logistics, Supply Chain Management, professional services, Housekeeping Management

column2: Seeking applications from senior Logistics and Supply Chain professionals with more than two decades of experience in end-to-end supply chain, logistics, and plant operations. A key role this position will be responsible to improve the efficiency of the organization and implement best practices.  Plan and implement overall supply chain and logistics strategy which covers inbound, outbound, and warehousing function.  Managing de-centralized warehouse operations and handling 3PL service providers  Manage and develop a professional logistics team and motivate them to attain maximum efficiency.  Streamline shipping process including import, domestic and export supply.  Exposure of managing import/ export and warehousing for sales company / customer center for MNC preferred.  Well conversant with Import and Export documentation and processes  Regularize and optimize transport processes, handling transport service providers and managing service level agreements by negotiating best rates.  Inventory management, material planning to meet inventory targets in terms of availability, number of days and ageing.  This includes physical control over inventory and handling periodic stock count procedures.  To set up and implement warehouse management systems.  Handling of dispatches and coordination with logistic service providers.  To lead and implement machine assembly set-up to meet MII requirements.  Efficient management of assembly operations and related vendor management.  Hands-on experience and good knowledge of ERP systems. Exposure to SAP preferred.  Good understanding of imports and customs clearance processes.  Responsible and point of contact for group sustainability activities.  Establish smooth communication and information flow with regions and dealers, internal and external stakeholders.  Administration of tax and other commercial issues related to logistics. Minimize supply chain costs and develop cost effective operations according to local and Group requirements  Identify process bottlenecks and suggest solutions for process improvement  Benchmark best practices from the Group and industry and suggest changes
column11: Supply Chain, Warehouse, Operations, Logistics

column2: Head of Supply Chain at Sarveshwar Foods Ltd. Location: Jammu, J&K. Overview: Sarveshwar Foods Ltd. is seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Supply Chain to oversee and optimize our supply chain operations, including factory management, warehousing, procurement, brand distribution, and commodity export and import. This role demands strategic leadership and a hands-on approach to ensure efficient inventory management, compliance, and seamless logistics. Key Responsibilities Factory Operations Management Oversee daily operations of the manufacturing facility, ensuring production targets and quality standards are met. Implement lean manufacturing practices to enhance productivity and reduce waste. Warehouse Management Supervise warehouse operations, including inventory control, storage, and distribution. Ensure that warehouse practices comply with safety regulations and industry standards. Procurement and Purchasing Manage the procurement process of raw materials and other essential supplies. Establish and maintain relationships with suppliers, negotiating favorable terms and ensuring timely delivery of materials. Brand Distribution  Develop and execute strategies for the distribution of brand products to various markets. Coordinate with sales and marketing teams to align distribution efforts with business goals. Export and Import Operations Oversee the export of commodities and ensure compliance with international trade regulations. Manage the import of necessary materials, optimizing costs and ensuring timely availability. Inventory Management and Audit Implement a just-in-time inventory strategy to minimize holding costs while ensuring product availability. Conduct regular inventory audits to verify stock levels and accuracy, identifying and addressing any discrepancies. Strategic Planning and Execution Develop and implement supply chain strategies to support business growth and operational efficiency. Analyze market trends and adjust supply chain strategies accordingly. Team Leadership and Development Lead and mentor a team of supply chain professionals, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and excellence. Provide training and development opportunities to enhance team capabilities. Make process and implement the supply chain strategies for product mobility in an streamline way.  Qualifications Educational Background : Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field. An MBA or postgraduate degree is preferred. Experience : Minimum of 10 years in supply chain management, with significant experience in the FMCG sector and at least 5 years in a leadership role. Skills : Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and negotiation abilities. Proficiency in supply chain software and ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle). Demonstrated ability to manage cross-functional teams and drive organizational change. Desire Profile :  Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and implement innovative supply chain solutions. High integrity, ethical standards, and a commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities effectively. Immediate Or early joiner will be preferred.   Application Process Interested candidates should submit their resume along with a cover letter detailing their relevant experience.
column11: Supply Chain Management, Inventory Control, Material Requirement Planning, Procurement Planning, Demand Forecasting, Operations Planning, Inventory Optimization, Inventory Planning, Brand Distribution, Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Warehouse Management, Demand Analysis
